title: Verb Patterns Basic - 3
instructions: Complete the sentences with the given verbs. Choose the to-infinitive or the gerund. Sometimes you will need the bare infinitive.

sentence: on holiday?' 'Yes, I can hardly wait
remarks: Corr: going. There's a preposition 'to', so we need to use the gerund.
Corr: to go. The verb 'wait' is followed by the to-infinitive.

sentence: my job.' 'Oh, don't go away. I promise
remarks: Corr: quitting. There's a preposition 'about', so we need the gerund.
Corr: to help. The verb 'promise' is followed by the to-infinitive.

sentence: When are you going to stop
remarks: Corr: crying. The verb 'stop' is followed by the gerund.

sentence: Why did the boss insist on
remarks: Corr: finishing. There's a preposition 'on', so we need the gerund.
Corr: cleaning. The verb 'postpone' is followed by the gerund.

sentence: this. Just put down that gun. Don't make me
remarks: Corr: to do. The verb 'need' is followed by the to-infinitive.
Corr: shoot. The verb 'make' is followed by the bare infinitive.
Corr: laze. The verb 'let' is followed by the bare infinitive.
Corr: to work. The verb 'like' can be followed by both the gerund and the to-infinitive, but 'would like' is followed only by the to-infinitive.

sentence: to the pub with you, but first we need
remarks: Corr: to go. The verb 'love' can be followed by both the gerund and the to-infinitive, but 'would love' only by the to-infinitive.
Corr: to finish. The verb 'need' is followed by the to-infinitive.
Corr: cleaning. The verb 'finish' is followed by the gerund.

sentence: some tickets for the play, but finally he managed
remarks: Corr: to get. The verb 'promise' is followed by the to-infinitive.
Corr: to get. The verb 'manage' is followed by the to-infinitive.

sentence: workers, but Francisc really made me
remarks: Corr: firing. The verb 'enjoy' is followed by the 'gerund'.
Corr: do. The verb 'make' is followed by the bare infinitive: make sb do sg.
